document_data.name: Zakharan Kraken
document_data.refs2e: {{Cite dragon/198/Campaign Journal: Scimitars against the Dark}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Zakharan kraken''' were a species of enormous highly intelligent and very evil [[squid]]-like creatures from the depths of the seas surrounding the continent of [[Zakhara]].The Zakharan kraken was part of the ''Dark Arabia'' variant for the ''[[Al-Qadim]]'' setting developed in [[Dragon magazine 198]].
document_data.Description: Zakharan kraken were albino creatures of gargantuan length, with ten tentacles, two of them bearing barbs.<ref group="note" name="note2">The artist's impression gives the Zakharan kraken a toothed maw and arms with webbed and clawed hands, while the text speaks of a beak and tentacles only. They could breathe both water and air.
document_data.Personality:
Zakharan kraken were hateful and evil denizens of the deep. They generally led solitary lives hatching plans of domination and the destruction of good creatures. They saw everything smaller than themselves as potential food or slaves.

Their usual diet consisted of [[octopus]]es, [[giant squid]], [[whale]]s, and the occasional smaller [[zaratan]]. They were also known to attack and destroy whole ships.
document_data.Combat:
Zakharan kraken usually tried to constrict prey with eight of their tentacles, two of them barbed, and bite with their beak.<ref group="note" name="note2"/> Their head was strongly armored. If a fight ran badly, the kraken could eject a cloud of poisonous [[ink]] and retreat by jetting backwards fast.

They also possessed the magical abilities of ''[[airy water]]'' and ''[[Control temperature, 10' radius|control temperature]]'' in large areas, ''[[faerie fire]]'',  ''[[control winds]]'', ''[[weather summoning]]'', and ''[[animal summoning III]]''.
document_data.Society:
Though their homeland was the depths of the warm [[Zakharan seas|seas around the Land of Fate]], Zakharan kraken could live in any climate.

Usually loners, they only gathered in groups at [[monsoon]] times to mate in ocean trenches. Their eggs were left there afterwards.

Some Zakharan kraken enslaved tribes of evil sea creatures like [[ixitxachitl]] or [[sahuagin]], or groups of [[human]]s to do their bidding and extend their reach towards the surface. They hated and despised the [[aboleth]].
document_data.History: In ages past, Zakharan kraken lived much closer to the shores. They interacted with humans who worshiped them. Some unknown event or conflict of great magnitude drove the kraken deep into the oceans. They became very few in number, but grew in size and power.
document_data.Rumors and Legends: It was said that [[Zakharan roc|rocs]] were the only predators that hunted at least young Zakharan kraken, and that sometimes [[marid]]s made them targets of hunts for distraction.
